alert.note: Alert for Dyer; Lake; Lauderdale (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 01 at 12:46PM CST until March 11 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Tennessee...Arkansas...Missouri... Mississippi River at Caruthersville For the Lower Mississippi River...including Tiptonville, Caruthersville, Osceola, Memphis, Tunica Mhoon Landing, Helena... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY, MARCH 11... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Caruthersville. * WHEN...Until Friday, March 11. * IMPACTS...At 34.0 feet, In Tennessee, Barr Road along the Middle Fork of the Forked Deer River is flooding near the bridge at the south end of Watkins Road. Water from the north bottom of Lauderdale County is now flowing over the basin boundary into the south bottomm of Lauderdale County. In Missouri, large business just north of Caruthersville is beginning to flood. Many fields adjacent to the Interstate 155 bridge are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM CST Tuesday the stage was 33.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:00 AM CST Tuesday was 33.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 34.5 feet Thursday evening. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday, March 10. - Flood stage is 32.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant.
